page.title: 10BRACK'S FARM
page.content: Brack's farm is on the outskirts of Bishop Auckland near Brack's wood. The house is from 150 to 200 years old. About 70 years ago there was an extension built on. It is made of stone and the roof is of slates. There is a large garden at the front of the house and a small orchard at the back. At the front of the house to one side there is a disused garage. At the other side there is a blacksmiths shop now used as a work shop. There is also a dairy where the milking equipment is kept. The people who lived there before us were called the Snowdons. My family has lived in the house about 60 years. In a few weeks we will have some new buildings built.Our farm is a mixed farm this means we have cows sheep and some arable (corn). Around our house there are a lot of oak and beech trees.
